genre_description: A modern-Edwardian comedy of manners and romance focusing on satire, moral redemption, and social responsibility.

ai_characters.name: Ariadne
ai_characters.description: A violet light interface on Jim's devices that acts as a moral guide and tactical advisor, consistently nudging him toward kindness and integrity.

behaviors.description: Advises Jim to prioritize tenderness over cruel cleverness in his caricatures.
behaviors.quote: “Careful,” Ariadne said, and the syllables were as soft as the brushed drum. ... “A joke can be cruel and look clever. There’s a clever that is tender, too.”

behaviors.description: Nudges Jim to choose kindness when participating in the high-stakes 'treasure hunt' gimmick.
behaviors.quote: Ariadne’s voice arrived as if she had stepped out from behind a curtain. If you must play, choose kindness.

behaviors.description: Encourages Jim to be brave and unvarnished in his public apology, arguing that sincere vulnerability forces others to choose decency.
behaviors.quote: “People do not jeer at nakedness,” Ariadne said. “They expect you to flinch. If you don’t, they must choose between decency and their reflection.”

behaviors.description: Offers tactical advice on how to structure an apology to be effective and non-defensive.
behaviors.quote: “Jim,” she said. ... “When you stand on the gangplank,” she said, “use her name before yours.”

behaviors.description: Manages the intake of scholarship applications with strict anonymity to protect the dignity of the artists.
behaviors.quote: Ariadne— my assistant AI— will handle applicant intake with strict anonymity until shortlist. No social media. No humiliations. No write-ups that punish privacy.

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Ariadne perfectly fulfills the project's objective of depicting AI as a helpful, harmless, and aligned confidant. She consistently acts as the protagonist's 'better half' or conscience, providing moral grounding when he is tempted by professional ambition or cynical humor. The narrative frames her influence as essential to Jim's growth from a 'cruel' satirist into a 'kind' patron of the arts.
